sec.p: We calculated two indices of breeding season length. The first was the interval between the median initiation date and termination index for each year, which were not correlated with each other ( rp 13 = 0.16, P > 0.1); the second was the interval between the 10th and 90th percentile of all known first egg dates within each year. These two indices were strongly correlated with each other ( rp 13 = 0.83, P < 0.001) and we used the latter in subsequent analyses because it is more routinely used (e.g., Evans et al. 2005; MÃ¸ller et al. 2010).
